(full name Bongard-Polonsky, 1924-1971) - an outstanding Soviet cybernetics, one of the founders of the theory of pattern recognition, the author of fundamental works in the field of color discrimination, a prominent researcher of perception and adaptive behavior. MM Bongard - one of the founders (along with Tsetlin) scientific school, range of interests that were the problem of mathematical modeling in biology, physiology, medicine and ethology. Achievement of this school in the inductive formation of concepts, models of view, the collective behavior of automata over these forty years constitute the cutting edge of world science.
